text: Biljana Plavšić (; born 7 July 1930) is a Serbian politician. She was the President of Republika Srpska between 1996 and 1998, who was later indicted in 2001 by the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) for war crimes committed in the Bosnian War. She plea-bargained with the ICTY and was sentenced to 11 years in prison in 2003. She was released on October 27, 2009 after serving two-thirds of her sentence. Plavšić is, together with Radovan Karadžić,Karadzic sentenced to 40 years for genocide the highest ranking Bosnian Serb politician to be sentenced. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:War criminals Category:Bosnian genocide Category:Presidents of Republika Srpska Category:Members of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina
title: Biljana Plavšić
